headers.subject: [Jersey] Passing objects in Jersey Service.
headers.dkim-signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=yahoo.com; s=s1024; t=1261000137; bh=Yn9VWZ3buHpJ3TqVoRxqYhB5xp3MoqGeDge5dJ7jDB0=; h=Message-ID:X-YMail-OSG:Received:X-Mailer:Date:From:Subject:To:MIME-Version:Content-Type; b=drWC7+OEfD9prp82EotLM87evcjrOtZF1A1ll8yVmfsacSKcAg211sCGB5iSXMnIzmjq62MMvBZgDg1VFmokwU0EhEK4ArrHHvBQVG2DpWq2qLMXYwxv9YkUbJWUNvewlpYCry5lBwublmyXq5iKTfwG0sdvsxFymWtc7Jv5kAs=

body.para:
Writing a web app that can be used as an application as well as service to
return a employee detail object. Method takes 2 objects as input and one boolean
variable. I want below method to be used in the app and the same method to serve
as restful service.

Is this correct approach or do I need to do anything else? Also I need to know
how I can test with the browser or any client? When I am trying to access it to
with the below url it gives me 404 -not found error.
body.footer: --------------------------------------------------------------------- To unsubscribe, e-mail: users-unsubscribe@jersey.dev.java.net For additional commands, e-mail: users-help@jersey.dev.java.net
